intro: Anisophyllea brachystila, commonly known as the short-stalked anisophyllea, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves with opposite or alternate arrangements. The plant typically grows as an understory species in humid, shaded forest environments. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties. Anisophyllea brachystila exhibits a unique leaf morphology, with varying leaflet shapes along its stems.
